data.title: Update for Tuesday, July 16, 2024
data.meta_description: HERNANDEZ GIVEN LIFE SENTENCE FOR 2021 MURDER — Daniel Hernandez was given a life sentence Monday following his guilty plea in May to the murder of 41-year-old Paradise resident Chad Vess. Prosecutors with the Wise County District Attorney’s Office presented evidence during a brief sentencing phase of the trial Monday afternoon in 271st District Court in Decatur. Hernandez, 63, of Boyd was sentenced as a habitual offender due to previous felony convictions, meaning he faced a minimum of 25 years or a maximum of life in prison for the offense. He pleaded guilty to murder on May 29, according to court records. The incident happened Nov. 30, 2021, at a home on County Road 4609 west of Boyd.
data.text:
HERNANDEZ GIVEN LIFE SENTENCE FOR 2021 MURDER — Daniel Hernandez was given a life sentence Monday following his guilty plea in May to the murder of 41-year-old Paradise resident Chad Vess. Prosecutors with the Wise County District Attorney’s Office presented evidence during a brief sentencing phase of the trial Monday afternoon in 271st District Court in Decatur. Hernandez, 63, of Boyd was sentenced as a habitual offender due to previous felony convictions, meaning he faced a minimum of 25 years or a maximum of life in prison for the offense. He pleaded guilty to murder on May 29, according to court records. The incident happened Nov. 30, 2021, at a home on County Road 4609 west of Boyd. Read more online here or in the upcoming edition of the Wise County Messenger.

DECATUR BOARD APPROVES PAY RAISE — The Decatur School Board yesterday approved a 2 percent pay increase for employees in next year’s budget. The pay increase would add an estimated $577,000 to the budget. The plan will give each teacher a $1,250 pay increase, and all other pay groups would receive a 2 percent of the midpoint increase. After some board members expressed concern about longevity pay not being included in the action item, interim Superintendent Karen Rue said that could still be a possibility in next year’s budget.

CHICO BUSINESS FEATURED AT MLB ALL-STAR GAME — Visitors to the Major League Baseball All-Star game festivities in Arlington this week may notice a giant floating baseball on the lake near the Texas Rangers’ former home, Choctaw Stadium. The 31-foot, 600-pound inflatable baseball was installed by Tiffany and Jake McLean of McLean Landscaping in Chico. The giant baseball displayed in the Capital One MLB All-Star Village is being touted as the world’s largest inflatable ball ever to be installed on water. Read more online here.

BULLS HIRE NEW BASEBALL COACH — For the second straight summer, the Bridgeport athletic department has hired a new skipper for the Bulls baseball program. Bridgeport athletic director Aaron Cupp announced last week the hiring of Chandler Casey, who will replace former coach Jon Lane. Casey recently was a graduate assistant for Lubbock Christian University. He pitched for the Chaparrals for two seasons (2018-19) and finished 11-6 with a 2.45 earned run average in 36 career appearances. He was drafted in the 26th round of the 2019 MLB Draft by the Houston Astros. In a three-year professional career, Casey reached Double-A and went 7-3 with a 5.34 ERA in the minor leagues. He then played independent league ball in the 2022 season for the Cleburne Railroaders. In his lone season at Bridgeport, Lane led the Bulls to a 6-12 overall record. The Bulls went 4-7 in District 8-4A play, claiming the fourth seed with a 5-0 tiebreaker win over Castleberry. Bridgeport was knocked out of the postseason bracket by 7-4A champion Burkburnett in a best-of-three bi-district series, 10-0 and 8-3.

HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED — Wise County remains under a heat advisory until 8 tonight. Today’s high is expected to be around 102 with heat index values as high as 107.

CITIZENS POLICE ACADEMY — The Decatur Police Department will host its Citizens Police Academy beginning Tuesday, July 30. The course will be held from 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. on Tuesdays at the Decatur Police Department and will end with a graduation ceremony Oct. 22. Class information and registration paperwork is available online at decaturtx.org. Contact Royce Gastineau at 940-393-0307 or rgastineau@decaturpd.net.

CAREGIVER SUPPORT — The Wise County Caregiver support group meets 2 p.m. every third Tuesday at the Decatur Conference Center. The Alzheimer’s Association support group provides emotional, educational and social support for caregivers through regularly scheduled meetings. Participants learn to develop coping methods and maintain their personal, physical and emotional health. Call Angie Tyson, 940-393-3677.

FUNERALS — Service for Patsy G. Clark, 91, of Alvord is 10:30 a.m. today at Hawkins Funeral Home in Decatur.

FUNERAL for Gary Zane Gardner, 78, is 2 p.m. Thursday at Victory Family Church. Family visitation is 6-8 p.m. Wednesday at Hawkins-Decatur.

GRAVESIDE service for Julie Amber Bunnell, 48, of Crowley will be held at a later date. Hawkins-Decatur is handling arrangements.

SERVICES for Filomena Vera, 96, of Fort Worth and Felix Lajara Romero, 85, of Decatur are pending at Hawkins-Decatur.

GRAVESIDE service for Tyce Lamar Simmons, 80, of Runaway Bay is 10:15 a.m. today at DFW National Cemetery. Hawkins Funeral Home in Bridgeport is handling arrangements.

MEMORIAL service for Andy Crisp, 68, of Boyd is 11 a.m. Saturday at Twin Oaks Assembly of God in Bridgeport. Family visitation is one hour prior to the service at the church. Hawkins-Bridgeport is handling arrangements.

FUNERAL for Helmi Norris, 87, of Bridgeport is 10 a.m. July 23 at First Baptist Church Paradise with burial at Paradise Cemetery. Family visitation is 6-8 p.m. Monday at Hawkins-Bridgeport.

MEMORIAL service for Jerry Rosson, 78, of Boyd is noon Saturday at 216 N. Agnew St. in Boyd. Hawkins Funeral Home in Boyd is handling arrangements.

SERVICE for JH “Sonny” Brazier Jr., 78, of Bridgeport is pending at Hudson & Torres Family Funeral Home in Bridgeport.
